subject: This Weekend on BBC Sport
body:
BBC SPORT














BBC Daily E-mail
Other e-mail newsletters

















JONATHAN DAVIES ON CHALLENGE CUP 5TH RND
The incentive to reach the Challenge Cup final is always immense, but there is an extra special reason to make it this year.


Rugby league's showpiece event returns to Wembley after an eight-year absence and it will be a very special occasion.


Clubs go into this weekend's games knowing they are just three wins away from stepping out to play at the fantastic new arena on 25 August.


On Saturday Leeds take on Wigan and I expect the Rhinos to make their home advantage count.


Wigan did narrowly win at Headingley in April, but they have been very up and down this season. 


The Warriors have quality players who can hurt anyone, although I think Leeds are going well enough at the moment to progress.


On Sunday, out-of-form Wakefield have to contend with the might of the Bradford Bulls.


The Wildcats have taken some heavy beatings recently, losing five out of their last six games, but in coach John Kear they have a man who can motivate teams for the big matches.


It might just take a one-off game such as this cup tie to reinvigorate their season and get them back into the sort of form we saw at the start of the year.


That said, the Bulls will be rampant favourites to progress as they are such a strong unit.


In fact I would probably have them as my favourites to go all the way.


They won't have it easy as the way the draw has fallen this year has seen many of the Super League big guns kept apart.


If this weekend's games go to form we should have seven out of the current top eight teams in the league contesting the quarter-finals and that is exactly what we want and expect at this stage of the competition.


Jonathan Davies played rugby league for Great Britain and Wales. He will be part of the BBC commentary team for Leeds v Wigan and Wakefield v Bradford.










THIS WEEKEND ON BBC SPORT
 All the TV and radio times









RUGBY LEAGUE
 bbc.co.uk/rugbyleague
Saturday
Challenge Cup fifth round, Leeds v Wigan (1430-1635, BBC ONE, BBC Sport website and Radio Five Live Sports Extra); Post-match forum (1630-1715, BBCi and website). 
Sunday
Challenge Cup fifth round, Wakefield v Bradford (1345-1545, BBC TWO and BBC Sport website).






FOOTBALL ON THE BBC
 bbc.co.uk/football
Saturday
Championship play-off semi-final commentary: Southampton v Derby (1200, Radio Five Live/online); Football Focus (1210, BBC ONE).
Sunday
Championship play-off semi-final commentary: Wolves v West Brom (1200, Radio Five Live/online); Score (1430, BBCi and BBC Sport website); Premiership commentary (1500, Radio Five Live/online); Final Score (1635, BBC ONE); Match of the Day (2220, BBC ONE).






PARALYMPIC WORLD CUP
 bbc.co.uk/disabilitysport
Sunday
Paralympic World Cup (1545-1740, BBC TWO)






MORE SPORT ON THE BBC
 bbc.co.uk/tvandradio
Saturday
Motorsport: F1 Spanish Grand Prix qualifying (0955-1100 and 1255-1400, Radio Five Live Sports Extra/online); Horse racing: Ascot and Haydock (1300-1430, BBC ONE and BBC Sport website); Rugby union: Guinness Premiership Final, Gloucester v Leicester (1430-1630, Radio Five Live/online)
Sunday
Inside Sport (1230-1315, BBC TWO); Motorsport: F1 Spanish Grand Prix (1300-1400, Radio Five Live Sports Extra/online); Rugby union: Premiership final highlights (1300-1345, BBC TWO).
